docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 1--President Juan D. Peron, at a press conference, denounced today the activities of Spruille Braden when the latter was United States Ambassador here in 1945, and said that the abortive Menendez revolt Friday had stemmed from that...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 1--President Juan D. Peron, at a press conference, denounced today the activities of Spruille Braden when the latter was United States Ambassador here in 1945, and said that the abortive Menendez revolt Friday had stemmed from that pe riod.
docs.abstract: lays revolt to Braden '45 activities; Braden denies charge; Peron sees plot product of 'madman'; denounces J F Griffith; Air Min Ojeda resignation reptd; arrests of Opposition leaders continue; 33 Air Force officers dismissed

headline.main: PERON TIES BRADEN TO ARGENTINE PLOT; Says Ex-Envoy's Activities in 1945 and Thereafter Paved Way for Recent Revolt 33 Air Officers Ousted

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 1--The Senate Foreign Relations Committee, with two members dissenting, voted today to recommend confirmation of Chester Bowles, former Democratic Governor of Connecticut, as Ambassador to India.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 1--The Senate Foreign Relations Committee, with two members dissenting, voted today to recommend confirmation of Chester Bowles, former Democratic Governor of Connecticut, as Ambassador to India.

headline.main: SENATE UNIT BACKS BOWLES AS ENVOY; Group Sends His Selection for India Post to Floor, Where Fight Is Expected Politics Seen in Selection

docs.snippet: EVANSTON, Ill., Oct. 1--Dr. Alberto Gainza Paz hailed the world's free press as the cornerstone of human liberty today and warned that totalitarian governments hated freedom of expression and were trying to stifle it. Whenever they succeed other...
docs.lead_paragraph: EVANSTON, Ill., Oct. 1--Dr. Alberto Gainza Paz hailed the world's free press as the cornerstone of human liberty today and warned that totalitarian governments hated freedom of expression and were trying to stifle it. Whenever they succeed other liberties soon are lost, too he declared.

headline.main: LIBERTIES IN PERIL, GAINZA PAZ WARNS; Publisher of La Prensa, Cited by Northwestern, Says Press is Dictators' Chief Target He Dared to Print the Truth"

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 2--Capt. Anibal Olivieri, new Navy Minister, announced today an almost complete change of the Argentine naval command, from the chief of operations down to naval district commanders.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 2--Capt. Anibal Olivieri, new Navy Minister, announced today an almost complete change of the Argentine naval command, from the chief of operations down to naval district commanders.
docs.abstract: Min Olivieri repts naval command changed; Rear Adm Villanueva named Operations Chief; Min Ojeda resigns; replaced by San Martin; Ojeda comment; some Opposition leaders freed; security rules tightened, Buenos Aires; Govt press names 2 Standard Oil workers as 'conspirators'; repts plot was laid at oil parley, Venezuela; NY Times correspondent A Cortesi named former plotter; 3 deny charges; rebels in Uruguay on revolt aims; Peron illus revg troops

headline.main: NAVAL SHAKE-UP ORDERED BY PERON; PERON REVIEWING HIS TROOPS AFTER THE REVOLT

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Thursday, Oct. 4 (UP)--Gen. Benjamin Menendez, retired, has been sentenced to fifteen years in prison for leading the abortive revolt against the Peron Government last Friday, it was reported reliably today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Thursday, Oct. 4 (UP)--Gen. Benjamin Menendez, retired, has been sentenced to fifteen years in prison for leading the abortive revolt against the Peron Government last Friday, it was reported reliably today.
docs.abstract: rebels reptd sentenced to prison; 200 pol leaders seen held; Army Min puts 7 alleged plotters on 'passive' list pending trial; San Martin sworn in; rebels in Uruguay illus

headline.main: VERDICT REPORTED IN ARGENTINE COUP; REVOLTING ARGENTINE OFFICERS IN URUGUAY

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct 3 (UP)--A constitutional reform abolishing the presidential system of government in favor of a nineman federal council on the Swiss model was approved today by the Chamber of Deputies in its first general reading.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct 3 (UP)--A constitutional reform abolishing the presidential system of government in favor of a nineman federal council on the Swiss model was approved today by the Chamber of Deputies in its first general reading.
docs.abstract: Deputies approve Council; Council to take office in Mar; Martinez seen chmn
